verse: यत्र हि द्वैतमिव भवति तदितर इतरं जिघ्रति तदितर इतरं पश्यति तदितर इतर शृणोति तदितर इतरमभिवदति तदितर इतरं मनुते तदितर इतरं विजानाति यत्र वा अस्य सर्वमात्मैवाभूत्तत्केन कं जिघ्रेत्तत्केन कं पश्येत्तत्केन क शृणुयात्तत्केन कमभिवदेत्तत् केन कं मन्वीत तत् केन कं विजानीयाद्येनेद सर्वं विजानाति तं केन विजानीयाद्विज्ञातारमरे केन विजानीयादिति॥

terms.विज्ञातारमरे: to the knower of the unknown

meaning: Translation:Where duality exists, one perceives others as different. One sees others as different, hears others as different, speaks to others as different, understands others as different, and knows others as different. Where everything is understood as the self, by whom can one smell? By whom can one see? By whom can one hear? By whom can one speak? By whom can one understand? By whom can one know? He who knows all, by whom can he be known? To the knower of the unknown, by whom can he be known? Thus it is.
